an5.264:0.3.eng: Another Discourse on the First Absorption

an5.264:1.1.pli: “Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhamme appahāya abhabbo paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharituṃ.
an5.264:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, without giving up these five qualities you can’t enter and remain in the first absorption.

an5.264:1.3.pli: Āvāsamacchariyaṃ, kulamacchariyaṃ, lābhamacchariyaṃ, vaṇṇamacchariyaṃ, akataññutaṃ akataveditaṃ.
an5.264:1.3.eng: Stinginess with dwellings, families, material things, praise, and lack of gratitude and thankfulness.

an5.264:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhamme appahāya abhabbo paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharituṃ.
an5.264:1.4.eng: Without giving up these five qualities you can’t enter and remain in the first absorption.

an5.264:2.1.pli: Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhamme pahāya bhabbo paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharituṃ.
an5.264:2.1.eng: But after giving up these five qualities you can enter and remain in the first absorption.

an5.264:2.3.pli: Āvāsamacchariyaṃ, kulamacchariyaṃ, lābhamacchariyaṃ, vaṇṇamacchariyaṃ, akataññutaṃ akataveditaṃ.
an5.264:2.3.eng: Stinginess with dwellings, families, material things, praise, and lack of gratitude and thankfulness.

an5.264:2.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhamme pahāya bhabbo paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharitun”ti.
an5.264:2.4.eng: After giving up these five qualities you can enter and remain in the first absorption.”

an5.265-271:0.3.eng: Another Discourse on the Second Absorption, Etc.

an5.265-271:1.1.pli: “Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhamme appahāya abhabbo dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ … tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ … catutthaṃ jhānaṃ … sotāpattiphalaṃ … sakadāgāmiphalaṃ … anāgāmiphalaṃ … arahattaṃ sacchikātuṃ.
an5.265-271:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, without giving up these five qualities you can’t enter and remain in the second absorption … third absorption … fourth absorption … or realize the fruit of stream-entry … the fruit of once-return … the fruit of non-return … perfection.

an5.265-271:1.3.pli: Āvāsamacchariyaṃ, kulamacchariyaṃ, lābhamacchariyaṃ, vaṇṇamacchariyaṃ, akataññutaṃ akataveditaṃ.
an5.265-271:1.3.eng: Stinginess with dwellings, families, material things, praise, and lack of gratitude and thankfulness.

an5.265-271:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhamme appahāya abhabbo arahattaṃ sacchikātuṃ.
an5.265-271:1.4.eng: Without giving up these five qualities you can’t realize perfection.

an5.265-271:2.1.pli: Pañcime, bhikkhave, dhamme pahāya bhabbo dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ … tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ … catutthaṃ jhānaṃ … sotāpattiphalaṃ … sakadāgāmiphalaṃ … anāgāmiphalaṃ … arahattaṃ sacchikātuṃ.
an5.265-271:2.1.eng: But after giving up these five qualities you can enter and remain in the second absorption … third absorption … fourth absorption … and realize the fruit of stream-entry … the fruit of once-return … the fruit of non-return … perfection.

an5.265-271:2.3.pli: Āvāsamacchariyaṃ, kulamacchariyaṃ, lābhamacchariyaṃ, vaṇṇamacchariyaṃ, akataññutaṃ akataveditaṃ.
an5.265-271:2.3.eng: Stinginess with dwellings, families, material things, praise, and lack of gratitude and thankfulness.

an5.265-271:2.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca dhamme pahāya bhabbo arahattaṃ sacchikātun”ti.
an5.265-271:2.4.eng: After giving up these five qualities you can realize perfection.”

an5.27:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, develop limitless immersion, alert and mindful.

an5.27:1.2.pli: Samādhiṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvayataṃ appamāṇaṃ nipakānaṃ patissatānaṃ pañca ñāṇāni paccattaññeva uppajjanti.
an5.27:1.2.eng: When you develop limitless immersion, alert and mindful, five knowledges arise for you personally.

an5.27:1.4.pli: ‘Ayaṃ samādhi paccuppannasukho ceva āyatiñca sukhavipāko’ti paccattaññeva ñāṇaṃ uppajjati,
an5.27:1.4.eng: ‘This immersion is blissful now, and results in bliss in the future.’ …

an5.27:1.5.pli: ‘ayaṃ samādhi ariyo nirāmiso’ti paccattaññeva ñāṇaṃ uppajjati,
an5.27:1.5.eng: ‘This immersion is noble and not of the flesh.’ …

an5.27:1.6.eng: ‘This immersion is not cultivated by reprobates.’ …

an5.27:1.7.pli: ‘ayaṃ samādhi santo paṇīto paṭippassaddhaladdho ekodibhāvādhigato, na sasaṅkhāraniggayhavāritagato’ti paccattaññeva ñāṇaṃ uppajjati,
an5.27:1.7.eng: ‘This immersion is peaceful and sublime and tranquil and unified, not held in place by forceful suppression.’ …

an5.27:1.8.pli: ‘sato kho panāhaṃ imaṃ samāpajjāmi sato vuṭṭhahāmī’ti paccattaññeva ñāṇaṃ uppajjati.
an5.27:1.8.eng: ‘I mindfully enter into and emerge from this immersion.’ …

an5.27:2.1.pli: Samādhiṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvetha appamāṇaṃ nipakā patissatā.
an5.27:2.1.eng: Develop limitless immersion, alert and mindful.

an5.27:2.2.pli: Samādhiṃ, bhikkhave, bhāvayataṃ appamāṇaṃ nipakānaṃ patissatānaṃ imāni pañca ñāṇāni paccattaññeva uppajjantī”ti.
an5.27:2.2.eng: When you develop limitless immersion, alert and mindful, these five knowledges arise for you personally.”

an5.272:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhattuddesako na sammannitabbo.
an5.272:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, someone with five qualities should not be appointed as meal assigner.

an5.272:1.3.pli: Chandāgatiṃ gacchati, dosāgatiṃ gacchati, mohāgatiṃ gacchati, bhayāgatiṃ gacchati, uddiṭṭhānuddiṭṭhaṃ na jānāti.
an5.272:1.3.eng: They make decisions prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice. And they don’t know if a meal has been assigned or not.

an5.272:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato bhattuddesako na sammannitabbo.
an5.272:1.4.eng: Someone with these five qualities should not be appointed as meal assigner.

an5.272:2.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhattuddesako sammannitabbo.
an5.272:2.1.eng: Someone with five qualities should be appointed as meal assigner.

an5.272:2.3.pli: Na chandāgatiṃ gacchati, na dosāgatiṃ gacchati, na mohāgatiṃ gacchati, na bhayāgatiṃ gacchati, uddiṭṭhānuddiṭṭhaṃ jānāti.
an5.272:2.3.eng: They don’t make decisions prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice. And they know if a meal has been assigned or not.

an5.272:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato bhattuddesako sammannitabboti.
an5.272:2.4.eng: Someone with these five qualities should be appointed as meal assigner.

an5.272:3.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhattuddesako sammato na pesetabbo …pe… sammato pesetabbo … bālo veditabbo … paṇḍito veditabbo … khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati … akkhataṃ anupahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati … yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye … yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.
an5.272:3.1.eng: Someone with five qualities who has been appointed as meal assigner should not be called upon … should be called upon … should be known as a fool … should be known as astute … they keep themselves broken and damaged … they keep themselves unbroken and undamaged … is cast down to hell … is raised up to heaven.

an5.272:3.3.pli: Na chandāgatiṃ gacchati, na dosāgatiṃ gacchati, na mohāgatiṃ gacchati, na bhayāgatiṃ gacchati, uddiṭṭhānuddiṭṭhaṃ jānāti.
an5.272:3.3.eng: They don’t make decisions prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice. And they know if a meal has been assigned or not.

an5.272:3.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato bhattuddesako yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge”ti.
an5.272:3.4.eng: A meal assigner with these five qualities is raised up to heaven.”

an5.273-285:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato senāsanapaññāpako na sammannitabbo …pe… paññattāpaññattaṃ na jānāti …pe… senāsanapaññāpako sammannitabbo …pe… paññattāpaññattaṃ jānāti …pe….
an5.273-285:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, someone with five qualities should not be appointed as lodgings allotter … they don’t know if a lodging has been allotted or not … Someone with five qualities should be appointed as lodgings allotter … they know if a lodging has been allotted or not …

an5.273-285:2.1.pli: Senāsanagāhāpako na sammannitabbo …pe… gahitāgahitaṃ na jānāti …pe… senāsanagāhāpako sammannitabbo …pe… gahitāgahitaṃ jānāti …pe….
an5.273-285:2.1.eng: A person should not be appointed as lodgings allocator … they don’t know if a lodging has been allocated or not … A person should be appointed as lodgings allocator … they know if a lodging has been allocated or not …

an5.273-285:3.1.pli: Bhaṇḍāgāriko na sammannitabbo …pe… guttāguttaṃ na jānāti … bhaṇḍāgāriko sammannitabbo …pe… guttāguttaṃ jānāti ….
an5.273-285:3.1.eng: A person should not be appointed as storeperson … they don’t know if stores are protected or not … A person should be appointed as storeperson … they know if stores are protected or not …

an5.273-285:4.1.pli: Cīvarapaṭiggāhako na sammannitabbo …pe… gahitāgahitaṃ na jānāti … cīvarapaṭiggāhako sammannitabbo …pe… gahitāgahitaṃ jānāti ….

an5.273-285:5.1.pli: Cīvarabhājako na sammannitabbo …pe… bhājitābhājitaṃ na jānāti … cīvarabhājako sammannitabbo …pe… bhājitābhājitaṃ jānāti ….

an5.273-285:8.1.pli: Khajjakabhājako na sammannitabbo …pe… bhājitābhājitaṃ na jānāti … khajjakabhājako sammannitabbo …pe… bhājitābhājitaṃ jānāti ….

an5.273-285:9.1.pli: Appamattakavissajjako na sammannitabbo …pe… vissajjitāvissajjitaṃ na jānāti … appamattakavissajjako sammannitabbo …pe… vissajjitāvissajjitaṃ jānāti ….

an5.273-285:10.1.pli: Sāṭiyaggāhāpako na sammannitabbo …pe… gahitāgahitaṃ na jānāti … sāṭiyaggāhāpako sammannitabbo …pe… gahitāgahitaṃ jānāti ….

an5.273-285:11.1.pli: Pattaggāhāpako na sammannitabbo …pe… gahitāgahitaṃ na jānāti … pattaggāhāpako sammannitabbo …pe… gahitāgahitaṃ jānāti ….

an5.273-285:14.1.pli: Sāmaṇerapesako bālo veditabbo …pe… paṇḍito veditabbo … khataṃ upahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati … akkhataṃ anupahataṃ attānaṃ pariharati … yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye … yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.

an5.273-285:14.3.pli: Na chandāgatiṃ gacchati, na dosāgatiṃ gacchati, na mohāgatiṃ gacchati, na bhayāgatiṃ gacchati, pesitāpesitaṃ jānāti.
an5.273-285:14.3.eng: They don’t make decisions prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice. And they know if a novice has been supervised or not.

an5.273-285:14.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato sāmaṇerapesako yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge”ti.
an5.273-285:14.4.eng: A supervisor of novices with these five qualities is raised up to heaven.”

an5.28:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you how to develop noble right immersion with five factors.

an5.28:1.2.pli: Taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
an5.28:1.2.eng: Listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”

an5.28:1.3.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.

an5.28:2.1.pli: “Katamā ca, bhikkhave, ariyassa pañcaṅgikassa sammāsamādhissa bhāvanā?
an5.28:2.1.eng: “And how do you develop noble right immersion with five factors?

an5.28:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vivicceva kāmehi …pe… paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
an5.28:2.2.eng: Firstly, a mendicant, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption. It has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.

an5.28:2.3.pli: So imameva kāyaṃ vivekajena pītisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripūreti parippharati; nāssa kiñci sabbāvato kāyassa vivekajena pītisukhena apphuṭaṃ hoti.
an5.28:2.3.eng: They drench, steep, fill, and spread their body with rapture and bliss born of seclusion. There’s no part of the body that’s not spread with rapture and bliss born of seclusion.

an5.28:2.4.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, dakkho nhāpako vā nhāpakantevāsī vā kaṃsathāle nhānīyacuṇṇāni ākiritvā udakena paripphosakaṃ paripphosakaṃ sanneyya. Sāyaṃ nhānīyapiṇḍi snehānugatā snehaparetā santarabāhirā phuṭā snehena, na ca paggharinī.
an5.28:2.4.eng: It’s like when a deft bathroom attendant or their apprentice pours bath powder into a bronze dish, sprinkling it little by little with water. They knead it until the ball of bath powder is soaked and saturated with moisture, spread through inside and out; yet no moisture oozes out.

an5.28:2.5.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu imameva kāyaṃ vivekajena pītisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripūreti parippharati;
an5.28:2.5.eng: In the same way, a mendicant drenches, steeps, fills, and spreads their body with rapture and bliss born of seclusion.

an5.28:2.6.pli: nāssa kiñci sabbāvato kāyassa vivekajena pītisukhena apphuṭaṃ hoti.
an5.28:2.6.eng: There’s no part of the body that’s not spread with rapture and bliss born of seclusion.

an5.28:2.7.pli: Ariyassa, bhikkhave, pañcaṅgikassa sammāsamādhissa ayaṃ paṭhamā bhāvanā.
an5.28:2.7.eng: This is the first way to develop noble right immersion with five factors.

an5.28:3.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamā …pe… dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
an5.28:3.1.eng: Furthermore, as the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, a mendicant enters and remains in the second absorption. It has the rapture and bliss born of immersion, with internal clarity and mind at one, without placing the mind and keeping it connected.

an5.28:3.2.pli: So imameva kāyaṃ samādhijena pītisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripūreti parippharati;
an5.28:3.2.eng: They drench, steep, fill, and spread their body with rapture and bliss born of immersion.

an5.28:3.3.pli: nāssa kiñci sabbāvato kāyassa samādhijena pītisukhena apphuṭaṃ hoti.
an5.28:3.3.eng: There’s no part of the body that’s not spread with rapture and bliss born of immersion.

an5.28:3.4.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, udakarahado gambhīro ubbhidodako. Tassa nevassa puratthimāya disāya udakassa āyamukhaṃ, na pacchimāya disāya udakassa āyamukhaṃ, na uttarāya disāya udakassa āyamukhaṃ, na dakkhiṇāya disāya udakassa āyamukhaṃ, devo ca kālena kālaṃ sammā dhāraṃ nānuppaveccheyya.
an5.28:3.4.eng: It’s like a deep lake fed by spring water. There’s no inlet to the east, west, north, or south, and the heavens would not properly bestow showers from time to time.

an5.28:3.5.pli: Atha kho tamhāva udakarahadā sītā vāridhārā ubbhijjitvā tameva udakarahadaṃ sītena vārinā abhisandeyya parisandeyya paripūreyya paripphareyya; nāssa kiñci sabbāvato udakarahadassa sītena vārinā apphuṭaṃ assa.
an5.28:3.5.eng: But the stream of cool water welling up in the lake drenches, steeps, fills, and spreads throughout the lake. There’s no part of the lake that’s not spread through with cool water.

an5.28:3.6.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu imameva kāyaṃ samādhijena pītisukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripūreti parippharati;
an5.28:3.6.eng: In the same way, a mendicant drenches, steeps, fills, and spreads their body with rapture and bliss born of immersion.

an5.28:3.7.pli: nāssa kiñci sabbāvato kāyassa samādhijena pītisukhena apphuṭaṃ hoti.
an5.28:3.7.eng: There’s no part of the body that’s not spread with rapture and bliss born of immersion.

an5.28:3.8.pli: Ariyassa, bhikkhave, pañcaṅgikassa sammāsamādhissa ayaṃ dutiyā bhāvanā.
an5.28:3.8.eng: This is the second way to develop noble right immersion with five factors.

an5.28:4.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pītiyā ca virāgā …pe… tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
an5.28:4.1.eng: Furthermore, with the fading away of rapture, a mendicant enters and remains in the third absorption. They meditate with equanimity, mindful and aware, personally experiencing the bliss of which the noble ones declare, ‘Equanimous and mindful, one meditates in bliss.’

an5.28:4.2.pli: So imameva kāyaṃ nippītikena sukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripūreti parippharati;
an5.28:4.2.eng: They drench, steep, fill, and spread their body with bliss free of rapture.

an5.28:4.3.pli: nāssa kiñci sabbāvato kāyassa nippītikena sukhena apphuṭaṃ hoti.
an5.28:4.3.eng: There’s no part of the body that’s not spread with bliss free of rapture.

an5.28:4.4.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, uppaliniyaṃ vā paduminiyaṃ vā puṇḍarīkiniyaṃ vā appekaccāni uppalāni vā padumāni vā puṇḍarīkāni vā udake jātāni udake saṃvaḍḍhāni udakānuggatāni anto nimuggaposīni.
an5.28:4.4.eng: It’s like a pool with blue water lilies, or pink or white lotuses. Some of them sprout and grow in the water without rising above it, thriving underwater.

an5.28:4.5.pli: Tāni yāva caggā yāva ca mūlā sītena vārinā abhisannāni parisannāni paripūrāni paripphuṭāni;
an5.28:4.5.eng: From the tip to the root they’re drenched, steeped, filled, and soaked with cool water.

an5.28:4.6.pli: nāssa kiñci sabbāvataṃ uppalānaṃ vā padumānaṃ vā puṇḍarīkānaṃ vā sītena vārinā apphuṭaṃ assa.
an5.28:4.6.eng: There’s no part of them that’s not spread through with cool water.

an5.28:4.7.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu imameva kāyaṃ nippītikena sukhena abhisandeti parisandeti paripūreti parippharati;
an5.28:4.7.eng: In the same way, a mendicant drenches, steeps, fills, and spreads their body with bliss free of rapture.

an5.28:4.8.pli: nāssa kiñci sabbāvato kāyassa nippītikena sukhena apphuṭaṃ hoti.
an5.28:4.8.eng: There’s no part of the body that’s not spread with bliss free of rapture.

an5.28:4.9.pli: Ariyassa, bhikkhave, pañcaṅgikassa sammāsamādhissa ayaṃ tatiyā bhāvanā.
an5.28:4.9.eng: This is the third way to develop noble right immersion with five factors.

an5.28:5.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sukhassa ca pahānā …pe… catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
an5.28:5.1.eng: Furthermore, with the giving up of pleasure and pain and the disappearance of former happiness and sadness, a mendicant enters and remains in the fourth absorption. It is without pleasure or pain, with pure equanimity and mindfulness.

an5.28:5.2.pli: So imameva kāyaṃ parisuddhena cetasā pariyodātena pharitvā nisinno hoti;
an5.28:5.2.eng: They sit spreading their body through with pure bright mind.

an5.28:5.3.pli: nāssa kiñci sabbāvato kāyassa parisuddhena cetasā pariyodātena apphuṭaṃ hoti.
an5.28:5.3.eng: There’s no part of the body that’s not spread with pure bright mind.

an5.28:5.4.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, puriso odātena vatthena sasīsaṃ pārupitvā nisinno assa;
an5.28:5.4.eng: It’s like someone sitting wrapped from head to foot with white cloth.

an5.28:5.5.pli: nāssa kiñci sabbāvato kāyassa odātena vatthena apphuṭaṃ assa.
an5.28:5.5.eng: There’s no part of the body that’s not spread over with white cloth.

an5.28:5.6.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu imameva kāyaṃ parisuddhena cetasā pariyodātena pharitvā nisinno hoti;
an5.28:5.6.eng: In the same way, they sit spreading their body through with pure bright mind.

an5.28:5.7.pli: nāssa kiñci sabbāvato kāyassa parisuddhena cetasā pariyodātena apphuṭaṃ hoti.
an5.28:5.7.eng: There’s no part of the body that’s not spread with pure bright mind.

an5.28:5.8.pli: Ariyassa, bhikkhave, pañcaṅgikassa sammāsamādhissa ayaṃ catutthā bhāvanā.
an5.28:5.8.eng: This is the fourth way to develop noble right immersion with five factors.

an5.28:6.1.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno paccavekkhaṇānimittaṃ suggahitaṃ hoti sumanasikataṃ sūpadhāritaṃ suppaṭividdhaṃ paññāya.
an5.28:6.1.eng: Furthermore, the meditation that is a basis for reviewing is properly grasped, focused on, borne in mind, and penetrated with wisdom by a mendicant.

an5.28:6.2.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, aññova aññaṃ paccavekkheyya, ṭhito vā nisinnaṃ paccavekkheyya, nisinno vā nipannaṃ paccavekkheyya.
an5.28:6.2.eng: It’s like when someone views someone else. Someone standing might view someone sitting, or someone sitting might view someone lying down.

an5.28:6.3.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno paccavekkhaṇānimittaṃ suggahitaṃ hoti sumanasikataṃ sūpadhāritaṃ suppaṭividdhaṃ paññāya.
an5.28:6.3.eng: In the same way, the meditation that is a basis for reviewing is properly grasped, focused on, borne in mind, and penetrated with wisdom by a mendicant.

an5.28:6.4.pli: Ariyassa, bhikkhave, pañcaṅgikassa sammāsamādhissa ayaṃ pañcamā bhāvanā.
an5.28:6.4.eng: This is the fifth way to develop noble right immersion with five factors.

an5.28:7.1.pli: Evaṃ bhāvite kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu ariye pañcaṅgike sammāsamādhimhi evaṃ bahulīkate yassa yassa abhiññāsacchikaraṇīyassa dhammassa cittaṃ abhininnāmeti abhiññāsacchikiriyāya, tatra tatreva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati sati āyatane.
an5.28:7.1.eng: When the noble right immersion with five factors is developed and cultivated in this way, a mendicant extends the mind to realize by insight each and every thing that can be realized by insight; and they are capable of realizing those things, since each and every one is within range.

an5.28:8.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, udakamaṇiko ādhāre ṭhapito pūro udakassa samatittiko kākapeyyo.
an5.28:8.1.eng: Suppose a water jar was placed on a stand, full to the brim so a crow could drink from it.

an5.28:8.2.pli: Tamenaṃ balavā puriso yato yato āvajjeyya, āgaccheyya udakan”ti?
an5.28:8.2.eng: If a strong man was to tip it any which way, would water pour out?”

an5.28:8.4.pli: “Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ bhāvite ariye pañcaṅgike sammāsamādhimhi evaṃ bahulīkate yassa yassa abhiññāsacchikaraṇīyassa dhammassa cittaṃ abhininnāmeti abhiññāsacchikiriyāya, tatra tatreva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati sati āyatane.
an5.28:8.4.eng: “In the same way, when noble right immersion with five factors is developed and cultivated in this way, a mendicant extends the mind to realize by insight each and every thing that can be realized by insight; and they are capable of realizing those things, since each and every one is within range.

an5.28:9.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, same bhūmibhāge pokkharaṇī caturaṃsā ālibaddhā pūrā udakassa samatittikā kākapeyyā.
an5.28:9.1.eng: Suppose there was a square, walled lotus pond on level ground, full to the brim so a crow could drink from it.

an5.28:9.2.pli: Tamenaṃ balavā puriso yato yato āliṃ muñceyya, āgaccheyya udakan”ti?
an5.28:9.2.eng: If a strong man was to open the wall on any side, would water pour out?”

an5.28:9.4.pli: “Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ bhāvite ariye pañcaṅgike sammāsamādhimhi evaṃ bahulīkate yassa yassa abhiññāsacchikaraṇīyassa dhammassa …pe… sati sati āyatane.
an5.28:9.4.eng: “In the same way, when noble right immersion with five factors is developed and cultivated in this way, a mendicant extends the mind to realize by insight each and every thing that can be realized by insight; and they are capable of realizing those things, since each and every one is within range.

an5.28:10.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, subhūmiyaṃ catumahāpathe ājaññaratho yutto assa ṭhito odhastapatodo.
an5.28:10.1.eng: Suppose a chariot stood harnessed to thoroughbreds at a level crossroads, with a goad ready.

an5.28:10.2.pli: Tamenaṃ dakkho yoggācariyo assadammasārathi abhiruhitvā vāmena hatthena rasmiyo gahetvā dakkhiṇena hatthena patodaṃ gahetvā yenicchakaṃ yadicchakaṃ sāreyyapi paccāsāreyyapi.
an5.28:10.2.eng: A deft horse trainer, a master charioteer, might mount the chariot, taking the reins in his right hand and goad in the left. He’d drive out and back wherever he wishes, whenever he wishes.

an5.28:10.3.pli: Evamevaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃ bhāvite ariye pañcaṅgike sammāsamādhimhi evaṃ bahulīkate yassa yassa abhiññāsacchikaraṇīyassa dhammassa cittaṃ abhininnāmeti abhiññāsacchikiriyāya,
an5.28:10.3.eng: In the same way, when noble right immersion with five factors is developed and cultivated in this way,

an5.28:10.4.pli: tatra tatreva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati sati āyatane.
an5.28:10.4.eng: a mendicant extends the mind to realize by insight each and every thing that can be realized by insight; and they are capable of realizing those things, since each and every one is within range.

an5.28:11.1.pli: So sace ākaṅkhati: ‘anekavihitaṃ iddhividhaṃ paccanubhaveyyaṃ—ekopi hutvā bahudhā assaṃ …pe… yāva brahmalokāpi kāyena vasaṃ vatteyyan’ti,
an5.28:11.1.eng: If you wish: ‘May I wield the many kinds of psychic power: multiplying myself and becoming one again … controlling the body as far as the realm of divinity.’

an5.28:11.2.pli: tatra tatreva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati sati āyatane.
an5.28:11.2.eng: You’re capable of realizing it, since each and every one is within range.

an5.28:12.1.pli: So sace ākaṅkhati: ‘dibbāya sotadhātuyā visuddhāya atikkantamānusikāya ubho sadde suṇeyyaṃ—dibbe ca mānuse ca ye dūre santike cā’ti,
an5.28:12.1.eng: If you wish: ‘With clairaudience that is purified and superhuman, may I hear both kinds of sounds, human and heavenly, whether near or far.’

an5.28:12.2.pli: tatra tatreva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati sati āyatane.
an5.28:12.2.eng: You’re capable of realizing it, since each and every one is within range.

an5.28:13.1.pli: So sace ākaṅkhati: ‘parasattānaṃ parapuggalānaṃ cetasā ceto paricca pajāneyyaṃ—
an5.28:13.1.eng: If you wish: ‘May I understand the minds of other beings and individuals, having encompassed them with my mind.

an5.28:13.2.pli: sarāgaṃ vā cittaṃ sarāgaṃ cittanti pajāneyyaṃ,
an5.28:13.2.eng: May I understand mind with greed as “mind with greed”,

an5.28:13.3.pli: vītarāgaṃ vā cittaṃ vītarāgaṃ cittanti pajāneyyaṃ,
an5.28:13.3.eng: and mind without greed as “mind without greed”;

an5.28:13.4.eng: mind with hate as “mind with hate”,

an5.28:13.5.eng: and mind without hate as “mind without hate”;

an5.28:13.6.eng: mind with delusion as “mind with delusion”,

an5.28:13.7.eng: and mind without delusion as “mind without delusion”;

an5.28:13.12.eng: mind that is not supreme as “mind that is not supreme”,

an5.28:13.13.eng: and mind that is supreme as “mind that is supreme”;

an5.28:13.14.eng: mind immersed in samādhi as “mind immersed in samādhi”,

an5.28:13.15.eng: and mind not immersed in samādhi as “mind not immersed in samādhi”;

an5.28:13.17.pli: avimuttaṃ vā cittaṃ avimuttaṃ cittanti pajāneyyan’ti,

an5.28:13.18.pli: tatra tatreva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati sati āyatane.
an5.28:13.18.eng: You’re capable of realizing it, since each and every one is within range.

an5.28:14.1.pli: So sace ākaṅkhati: ‘anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussareyyaṃ, seyyathidaṃ—ekampi jātiṃ, dvepi jātiyo …pe… iti sākāraṃ sauddesaṃ anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussareyyan’ti,
an5.28:14.1.eng: If you wish: ‘May I recollect many kinds of past lives, with features and details.’

an5.28:14.2.pli: tatra tatreva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati sati āyatane.
an5.28:14.2.eng: You’re capable of realizing it, since each and every one is within range.

an5.28:15.1.pli: So sace ākaṅkhati: ‘dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena …pe… yathākammūpage satte pajāneyyan’ti,
an5.28:15.1.eng: If you wish: ‘With clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, may I see sentient beings passing away and being reborn according to their deeds.’

an5.28:15.2.pli: tatra tatreva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati sati āyatane.
an5.28:15.2.eng: You’re capable of realizing it, since each and every one is within range.

an5.28:16.1.pli: So sace ākaṅkhati: ‘āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyyan’ti,
an5.28:16.1.eng: If you wish: ‘May I realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with my own insight due to the ending of defilements.’

an5.28:16.2.pli: tatra tatreva sakkhibhabbataṃ pāpuṇāti sati sati āyatane”ti.
an5.28:16.2.eng: You’re capable of realizing it, since each and every one is within range.”

an5.286:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an5.286:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a monk with five qualities is cast down to hell.

an5.286:1.3.pli: Pāṇātipātī hoti, adinnādāyī hoti, abrahmacārī hoti, musāvādī hoti, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhāyī hoti.
an5.286:1.3.eng: He kills living creatures, steals, has sex, lies, and consumes beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

an5.286:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an5.286:1.4.eng: A monk with these five qualities is cast down to hell.

an5.286:2.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.
an5.286:2.1.eng: A monk with five qualities is raised up to heaven.

an5.286:2.3.pli: Pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti, abrahmacariyā paṭivirato hoti, musāvādā paṭivirato hoti, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato hoti.
an5.286:2.3.eng: He doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, have sex, lie, or consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

an5.286:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge”ti.
an5.286:2.4.eng: A monk with these five qualities is raised up to heaven.”

an5.287-292:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgatā bhikkhunī …pe… sikkhamānā … sāmaṇero … sāmaṇerī … upāsako … upāsikā yathābhataṃ nikkhittā evaṃ niraye.
an5.287-292:1.1.eng: “A nun … trainee nun … novice monk … novice nun … layman … laywoman … with five qualities is cast down to hell.

an5.287-292:1.3.pli: Pāṇātipātinī hoti, adinnādāyinī hoti, kāmesumicchācārinī hoti, musāvādinī hoti, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhāyinī hoti.
an5.287-292:1.3.eng: They kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, and consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

an5.287-292:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgatā upāsikā yathābhataṃ nikkhittā evaṃ niraye.
an5.287-292:1.4.eng: With these five qualities they’re cast down to hell.

an5.287-292:2.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgatā upāsikā yathābhataṃ nikkhittā evaṃ sagge.
an5.287-292:2.1.eng: A nun … trainee nun … novice monk … novice nun … layman … laywoman … with five qualities is raised up to heaven.

an5.287-292:2.3.pli: Pāṇātipātā paṭiviratā hoti, adinnādānā paṭiviratā hoti, kāmesumicchācārā paṭiviratā hoti, musāvādā paṭiviratā hoti, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭiviratā hoti.
an5.287-292:2.3.eng: They don’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

an5.287-292:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgatā upāsikā yathābhataṃ nikkhittā evaṃ sagge”ti.
an5.287-292:2.4.eng: With these five qualities they’re raised up to heaven.”

an5.29:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are five benefits of walking meditation.

an5.29:1.3.pli: Addhānakkhamo hoti, padhānakkhamo hoti, appābādho hoti, asitaṃ pītaṃ khāyitaṃ sāyitaṃ sammā pariṇāmaṃ gacchati, caṅkamādhigato samādhi ciraṭṭhitiko hoti.
an5.29:1.3.eng: You get fit for traveling, fit for striving in meditation, and healthy. What’s eaten, drunk, chewed, and tasted is properly digested. And immersion gained while walking lasts long.

an5.29:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca caṅkame ānisaṃsā”ti.
an5.29:1.4.eng: These are the five benefits of walking meditation.”

an5.293:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato ājīvako yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an5.293:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, an Ājīvaka ascetic with five qualities is cast down to hell.

an5.293:1.3.pli: Pāṇātipātī hoti, adinnādāyī hoti, abrahmacārī hoti, musāvādī hoti, surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhāyī hoti.
an5.293:1.3.eng: They kill living creatures, steal, have sex, lie, and consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

an5.293:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato ājīvako yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye”ti.
an5.293:1.4.eng: An Ājīvaka ascetic with these five qualities is cast down to hell.”

an5.294-302:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato nigaṇṭho … muṇḍasāvako … jaṭilako … paribbājako … māgaṇḍiko … tedaṇḍiko … āruddhako … gotamako … devadhammiko yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an5.294-302:1.1.eng: “A Jain ascetic … disciple of the shavelings … a matted-hair ascetic … a wanderer … a follower of Māgaṇḍiya … a trident-bearing ascetic … a follower of the unobstructed … a follower of Gotama … a performer of rituals for the gods … with five qualities is cast down to hell.

an5.294-302:1.3.pli: Pāṇātipātī hoti, adinnādāyī hoti …pe… surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhāyī hoti.
an5.294-302:1.3.eng: They kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, and consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

an5.294-302:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato devadhammiko yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye”ti.
an5.294-302:1.4.eng: With these five qualities they’re cast down to hell.”

an5.3:1.1.pli: “Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu diṭṭheva dhamme dukkhaṃ viharati savighātaṃ saupāyāsaṃ sapariḷāhaṃ, kāyassa ca bhedā paraṃ maraṇā duggati pāṭikaṅkhā.
an5.3:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, when a mendicant has five qualities they live unhappily in this very life—with distress, anguish, and fever—and when the body breaks up, after death, they can expect a bad rebirth.

an5.3:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu assaddho hoti, ahiriko hoti, anottappī hoti, kusīto hoti, duppañño hoti.
an5.3:1.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant is faithless, shameless, imprudent, lazy, and witless.

an5.3:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu diṭṭheva dhamme dukkhaṃ viharati savighātaṃ saupāyāsaṃ sapariḷāhaṃ, kāyassa ca bhedā paraṃ maraṇā duggati pāṭikaṅkhā.
an5.3:1.4.eng: When a mendicant possesses these five qualities they live unhappily in this very life—with distress, anguish, and fever—and when the body breaks up, after death, they can expect a bad rebirth.

an5.3:2.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu diṭṭheva dhamme sukhaṃ viharati avighātaṃ anupāyāsaṃ apariḷāhaṃ, kāyassa ca bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugati pāṭikaṅkhā.
an5.3:2.1.eng: When a mendicant has five qualities they live happily in this very life—without distress, distress, or fever—and when the body breaks up, after death, they can expect a good rebirth.

an5.3:2.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddho hoti, hirīmā hoti, ottappī hoti, āraddhavīriyo hoti, paññavā hoti.
an5.3:2.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant is faithful, conscientious, prudent, energetic, and wise.

an5.3:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu diṭṭheva dhamme sukhaṃ viharati avighātaṃ anupāyāsaṃ apariḷāhaṃ, kāyassa ca bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugati pāṭikaṅkhā”ti.
an5.3:2.4.eng: When a mendicant possesses these five qualities they live happily in this very life—without distress, anguish, or fever—and when the body breaks up, after death, they can expect a good rebirth.”
